DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Mitoxantrone hydrochloride is a type of chemotherapy drug called an anthracycline. It blocks an enzyme called topoisomerase II, which cuts and repairs tangled strands of DNA. This stops or slows the growth of cancer cells and other rapidly dividing cells and causes them to die.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Mitoxantrone hydrochloride is approved to be used with other drugs to treat:

ItemizedList.ListItem: Prostate cancer. It is used as palliative treatment in patients with advanced disease that is hormone-refractory (does not respond to hormone treatment).

Section.Para: Mitoxantrone hydrochloride is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
